body:
@shousper thanks for reporting this issue. It's weird because this case should be protected there https://github.com/sirupsen/logrus/blob/251d6bf71382da18d56ae619e48a8404728b40b0/text_formatter.go#L128
Can you provide a test case to reproduce this issue ?

> We're also adding a field "func"

not what I meant when I said I wanted us to context components

Hello @shousper , thanks for your test case, but I do not reproduce the issue whether the report caller is enabled or not.
Can you provide which version you are on ?

@dgsb I meet the same problem with the latest logrus. And the same error and same line code is broken. 
The panic is:
```
/Users/chao/Code/go/src/github.com/sirupsen/logrus/text_formatter.go:179 (0x1585e1f)
	(*TextFormatter).Format: value = fmt.Sprintf("%s:%d", entry.Caller.File, entry.Caller.Line)
/Users/chao/Code/go/src/github.com/rifflock/lfshook/lfshook.go:137 (0x159267f)
	(*LfsHook).ioWrite: msg, err = hook.formatter.Format(entry)
/Users/chao/Code/go/src/github.com/rifflock/lfshook/lfshook.go:108 (0x15924ff)
```
I think @shousper is right, you should check if the **entry has a Caller** before using it.

I got same issue since i upgraded to go1.11, but only when my app is launched via systemd (syslog output).
Launching it directly with stdout works fine.

```
Oct 30 14:11:25 scout-out1-pprod comue-milter[44020]: goroutine 1 [running]:
Oct 30 14:11:25 scout-out1-pprod comue-milter[44020]: github.com/sirupsen/logrus.(*TextFormatter).Format(0xc4200626e0, 0xc420052b40, 0xc4200523f0, 0x0, 0xc420052b40, 0xc42013daa8, 0x42be49)
Oct 30 14:11:25 scout-out1-pprod comue-milter[44020]: #011/go/src/github.com/sirupsen/logrus/text_formatter.go:179 +0x932
Oct 30 14:11:25 scout-out1-pprod comue-milter[44020]: github.com/sirupsen/logrus.(*Entry).write(0xc420052b40)
Oct 30 14:11:25 scout-out1-pprod comue-milter[44020]: #011/go/src/github.com/sirupsen/logrus/entry.go:232 +0x93
Oct 30 14:11:25 scout-out1-pprod comue-milter[44020]: github.com/sirupsen/logrus.Entry.log(0xc4200523c0, 0xc42010af90, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, ...)
Oct 30 14:11:25 scout-out1-pprod comue-milter[44020]: #011/go/src/github.com/sirupsen/logrus/entry.go:208 +0x1c9
Oct 30 14:11:25 scout-out1-pprod comue-milter[44020]: github.com/sirupsen/logrus.(*Entry).Info(0xc420052ae0, 0xc42013dc60, 0x1, 0x1)
Oct 30 14:11:25 scout-out1-pprod comue-milter[44020]: #011/go/src/github.com/sirupsen/logrus/entry.go:261 +0xae
```

```
c.conf.log.WithFields(logrus.Fields{
            "MessagesTablesLength":     len(c.MessagesTables),
            "BlockedUsersLength":       len(c.BlockedUsers),
            "BlockedMessagesLength":    len(c.BlockedMessages),
            "file":                     "/tmp/milter_go.gob",
    }).Info("Chargement de l'état précédent");  
```
Reverting to tags/v1.1.1 works for me (master branch broken on go 1.9+).

I've still not been able to reproduce the issue on my environment.
Can someone can provide a PR with a unit test which would exhibit the issue on travis CI ?
The smaller the test is the better.
Ok, I've reproduced the issue. It's related to the output coloring disabled on the text formatter. I will have a look at asap.

issue.title: fix panic in text formatter
issue.body:
The panic was caused to a nil pointer access when report
caller was activated with output coloring disabled

Fixes #852

issue.title: qtmoc/qtdeploy: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference

repository.name: qt
repository.description: Qt binding for Go (Golang) with support for Windows / macOS / Linux / FreeBSD / Android / iOS / Sailfish OS / Raspberry Pi / AsteroidOS / Ubuntu Touch / JavaScript / WebAssembly

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0
